episodeTitle: Admiral Kizaru Takes Action! Sabaody Archipelago Thrown into Chaos
episodeTitleJapanese: 大将黄猿動く！騒然シャボンディ諸島
episodeTitleRomanized: Taishō Kizaru Ugoku! Sōzen Shabondi Shotō
description: After Luffy strikes Saint Charlos, Fleet Admiral Sengoku dispatches Admiral Kizaru to Sabaody Archipelago. Inside the Human Auctioning House, Silvers Rayleigh demonstrates the mysterious power of Haki and removes Camie's explosive collar. Outside, Luffy, Kid, and Law face off against the Marines while Doflamingo abandons the slave trade to focus on SMILEs.

events.title: Rayleigh Unleashes Conqueror's Haki
events.description: Inside the Human Auctioning House, Silvers Rayleigh unleashes a powerful wave of Conqueror's Haki, instantly knocking unconscious most of the people present, including Marines, pirates, and auction attendees. This is the first explicit demonstration of Haki in the anime series.
events.significance: This marks the first major introduction of Haki as a concept in the One Piece anime. The mysterious power that Rayleigh displays will become a fundamental combat system in the series.

quotes.text: What just happened? Everyone just collapsed!
quotes.speaker: Various Pirates
quotes.context: Witnesses reacting to Rayleigh's Haki display

events.title: Rayleigh Removes Camie's Explosive Collar
events.description: Rayleigh carefully calculates the timing and removes Camie's explosive collar just before it detonates, tossing it away safely. This demonstrates his advanced Armament Haki abilities, though this is not explicitly explained at the time.
events.significance: This scene showcases advanced Armament Haki technique that Luffy will later learn. It becomes a callback moment when Luffy removes prison collars in Wano using the same technique.

quotes.text: Don't worry, I'll have that off in a moment.
quotes.speaker: Silvers Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh assuring Camie before removing her collar

events.title: First Mention of 'Haki' by Name
events.description: Hatchan explains to the shocked onlookers that the mysterious power Rayleigh used is called 'Haki.' This is the first time the word 'Haki' is spoken in the One Piece anime, introducing a fundamental power system.
events.significance: This moment introduces the term 'Haki' to the audience, establishing it as a legitimate power system separate from Devil Fruits. This will become one of the core combat mechanics of the series.

quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: Hatchan explaining Rayleigh's power to the Straw Hats and other pirates

events.title: Doflamingo Mentions 'SMILEs' for the First Time
events.description: When Disco contacts Doflamingo about the attack on the auction house, Doflamingo declares that slavery is passé and reveals he's moving on to 'SMILEs,' saying they are the future. This is the first mention of SMILEs in the series.
events.significance: This is one of the most significant pieces of long-term foreshadowing in One Piece. SMILEs won't appear or be mentioned again for over 200 episodes, but they become crucial to the Punk Hazard, Dressrosa, and Wano arcs.

quotes.text: Slavery is passé. SMILEs are the future.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo abandoning the slave trade business over Den Den Mushi

events.title: Doflamingo Abandons the Auction House
events.description: Donquixote Doflamingo tells Disco that he's washing his hands of the Human Auctioning House business entirely, leaving Disco to deal with the consequences of the Straw Hats' attack alone.
events.significance: This shows Doflamingo's ruthless business sense and his willingness to abandon ventures that no longer serve his purposes. It also foreshadows his involvement in the artificial Devil Fruit business.

quotes.text: I'm done with the auction house. You're on your own.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo

events.title: Sengoku Dispatches Admiral Kizaru
events.description: Fleet Admiral Sengoku, upon hearing that a Celestial Dragon has been struck, immediately dispatches Admiral Kizaru to Sabaody Archipelago to deal with the situation and restore the World Nobles' honor.
events.significance: This sets in motion the catastrophic events that will scatter the Straw Hat crew. Kizaru's arrival will lead to the crew's separation and the two-year time skip.

quotes.text: Kizaru, go to Sabaody immediately. We cannot let this attack on the Celestial Dragons go unanswered.
quotes.speaker: Sengoku
quotes.context: Sengoku giving orders to dispatch Kizaru

events.title: Marines Surround the Auction House
events.description: A large Marine force surrounds the Human Auctioning House with artillery and firearms, demanding the surrender of the Straw Hat Pirates and the other Supernovas present as accomplices.
events.significance: This escalates the Celestial Dragon incident into a full-scale confrontation, forcing the Supernovas to work together temporarily.

events.title: Rayleigh Instructs Pirates to Escape to Grove 13
events.description: Silvers Rayleigh tells the pirates present that he'll leave their escape to them, and instructs them to regroup at Grove 13, where Shakky's bar is located.
events.significance: This establishes Grove 13 as a safe haven and meeting point. Rayleigh's confidence in the rookie pirates shows his recognition of the new generation's potential.

quotes.text: I'll leave the escape to you young ones. Head to Grove 13.
quotes.speaker: Silvers Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh entrusting the rookies with their escape

events.title: Three Supernovas Exit Together
events.description: Luffy, Eustass Kid, and Trafalgar Law walk out of the auction house together, bickering over who could handle the Marine siege single-handedly. This forms an iconic moment of the three captain rivals standing side by side.
events.significance: This is the first time these three captains of the Worst Generation unite, foreshadowing their future alliance and rivalry. The scene becomes iconic for showing the new generation's defiance.

quotes.text: I could clear this whole thing by myself!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy boasting as they exit the auction house

quotes.text: Hah! That's my line, Straw Hat!
quotes.speaker: Eustass Kid

events.title: Luffy Uses Gomu Gomu no Fusen Against Cannonballs
events.description: When the Marines fire cannonballs at the pirates, Luffy inflates his body using Gomu Gomu no Fusen to deflect a cannonball heading toward him.
events.significance: This demonstrates Luffy's rubber abilities in a defensive capacity, showing his creative use of his Devil Fruit powers.

events.title: Eustass Kid Displays Magnetic Powers
events.description: Eustass Kid uses his Devil Fruit ability to stop an incoming cannonball with magnetic force, then redirects it back at the Marines' mortars with even greater force, destroying their artillery.
events.significance: This is the first clear display of Kid's Jiki Jiki no Mi (Magnet-Magnet Fruit) powers in the anime, revealing his Devil Fruit ability to manipulate magnetism and control metal.

events.title: Trafalgar Law Demonstrates 'Room' Ability
events.description: Trafalgar Law creates a spherical energy field around himself called 'Room,' then uses his power to swap a nearby Marine's head with a cannonball. The Marine remains alive despite the grotesque transformation, demonstrating Law's surgical abilities.
events.significance: This is the first display of Law's Ope Ope no Mi (Op-Op Fruit) powers and the iconic 'Room' technique. Though not named yet, this ability will become Law's signature move.

quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law creating his spherical domain before using his power

events.title: News Spreads of Celestial Dragon Attack
events.description: Word of Luffy striking a Celestial Dragon spreads rapidly across Sabaody Archipelago, causing panic among the civilians and pirates who understand the severe consequences of such an action.
events.significance: This shows the terror that the World Nobles inspire across the world and sets up the grave consequences the Straw Hats will face.

quotes.speaker: Hatchan
quotes.context: First explicit mention of Haki in the anime

quotes.text: Slavery is passé. SMILEs are the future.
quotes.speaker: Donquixote Doflamingo
quotes.context: Doflamingo foreshadowing the SMILE Devil Fruits arc

quotes.text: I'll leave the escape to you young ones. Head to Grove 13.
quotes.speaker: Silvers Rayleigh
quotes.context: Rayleigh entrusting the rookies with their escape

quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law's first use of his signature technique

themes.description: The episode showcases the passing of the torch from the old generation (Rayleigh) to the new (Luffy, Kid, Law). Rayleigh demonstrates his power but leaves the escape to the young pirates.
themes.symbolism: Rayleigh's confidence in the rookies represents his faith in the new generation to change the world.

themes.description: The episode explores the severe consequences of challenging the World Government's authority by attacking a Celestial Dragon, with Admiral Kizaru being dispatched.
themes.symbolism: The massive Marine response represents the oppressive power of the World Government.

themes.description: The introduction of Haki as a named power system expands the world of One Piece beyond just Devil Fruits, showing there are other paths to strength.
themes.symbolism: Haki represents willpower and ambition given physical form.
culturalReferences: 霸気 (Haki) literally means 'ambition' or 'supreme authority' in Japanese

characterSpotlights.role: Mentor figure revealing new power system
characterSpotlights.development: Rayleigh demonstrates his tremendous power with Haki and shows wisdom by trusting the young generation to escape on their own.
keyActions: Unleashes Conqueror's Haki on the auction house
Removes Camie's explosive collar with advanced technique
Instructs the pirates to escape to Grove 13
quotes: I'll leave the escape to you young ones. Head to Grove 13.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy faces the dire consequences of his actions against Saint Charlos, but remains undeterred and ready to fight alongside rival captains.
keyActions: Exits the auction house with Kid and Law
Uses Gomu Gomu no Fusen to deflect cannonballs
Stands defiant against the Marine siege
quotes: I could clear this whole thing by myself!

characterSpotlights.development: Law displays his Devil Fruit powers for the first time, showing his cruel yet effective fighting style and establishing himself as a formidable captain.
keyActions: Swaps a Marine's head with a cannonball

characterSpotlights.development: Kid demonstrates his magnetic Devil Fruit powers and his competitive nature with Luffy, establishing their rivalry.
keyActions: Uses magnetic powers to redirect cannonballs
Bickers with Luffy over who could handle the Marines
Destroys Marine artillery with reflected cannonballs
quotes: Hah! That's my line, Straw Hat!

characterSpotlights.development: Doflamingo reveals his forward-thinking criminal enterprise by abandoning slavery for the SMILE business, showing his ruthless pragmatism.
keyActions: Mentions SMILEs for the first time
quotes: Slavery is passé. SMILEs are the future.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the scenes of the Marines preparing outside the auction house, adding more dialogue and reaction shots from civilians.
The visual depiction of Rayleigh's Conqueror's Haki is more dramatic in the anime with added visual effects showing the wave of power.

trivia.fact: This is the first time the word 'Haki' is spoken in the One Piece anime, introducing one of the series' fundamental power systems.
Doflamingo's mention of SMILEs in this episode is remarkable foreshadowing, as SMILEs don't appear or get mentioned again for over 200 episodes (Episode 615).

sources.title: One Piece's 5 Most Overlooked Pieces of Foreshadowing

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 504 of the manga, titled 'Pirate Front Jolly Rogers, Dance.'
The technique Rayleigh uses to remove Camie's collar is later explained to be advanced Armament Haki, which Luffy learns and uses in Wano to remove explosive collars (Episode 947).
Episode 398 has a 9.0/10 rating on IMDB, making it one of the highest-rated episodes of the Sabaody Archipelago arc.
Unshō Ishizuka, who voiced Admiral Kizaru in this episode, passed away in August 2018 and was replaced by Ryōtarō Okiayu.

sources.title: Ryotaro Okiayu Replaces Late Unshō Ishizuka as One Piece's Kizaru
